CControl

Basic control class from which all controls extend.

Summary
CControlBasic control class from which all controls extend.
Functions
AutosizeResizes the control to fit its contents
ShowShows the control if it was previously hidden.
HideHides the control if it was previously visible.
EnableEnables the control if it was previously diisabled.
DisableDisables the control if it was previously enabled.
FocusSets the focus to this control.
RedrawRedraws the control.
RegisterEventAttention! 
Properties
xx-Position of the control.
yy-Position of the control.
widthWidth of the control.
heightHeight of the control.
PositionAn object containing the x and y values.
SizeAn object containing the width and height values.
TextThe text of the control.
ClassNNThe control class together with a number identify the control.
EnabledDetermines wether this control can be interacted with.
VisibleDetermines wether this control is currently visible.
StyleThe style of the control.
ExStyleThe extended style of the control.
FocusedTrue if the control currently has the focus.
TooltipIf a text is set for this value, this control will show a tooltip when the mouse hovers over it.
MenuIf this variable contains an instance of CMenu and there is no ContextMenu() event handler for this control, this menu will be shown when the user right clicks on this control or presses the AppsKey while this control has focus.
LeftThe control left-aligns its text.
CenterThe control center-aligns its text.
RightThe control right-aligns its text.
TabStopIf set to false, this control will not receive the focus when pressing tab to cycle through all controls.
WrapIf enabled, the control will use word-wrapping for its text.
HScrollProvides a horizontal scroll bar for this control if appropriate.
VScrollProvides a vertical scroll bar for this control if appropriate.
BackgroundTransUses a transparent background, which allows any control that lies behind a Text, Picture, or GroupBox control to show through.
BackgroundIf disable, the control uses the standard background color rather than the one set by the CGUI.Color() function.
BorderProvides a thin-line border around the control.
hParentControlIf this control is a subcontrol of another control, this variable contains the window handle of the parent control.
DisableNotificationsIf true, this control will not call any of its notification functions.
Events
Introduction1) Use an event handler.
ContextMenuInvoked when the user right clicks on the control or presses the AppsKey while this control has focus.
OnValidateInvoked when the control is asked to validate its (textual) contents.
CImageListManagerThis class is used internally to manage the ImageLists of ListView/TreeView/Tab controls.

Functions

Autosize

Resizes the control to fit its contents

Show

Shows the control if it was previously hidden.

Hide

Hides the control if it was previously visible.

Enable

Enables the control if it was previously diisabled.

Disable

Disables the control if it was previously enabled.

Focus

Sets the focus to this control.

Redraw

Redraws the control.  This can sometimes fix drawing issues.

RegisterEvent

Attention!  This function is deprecated!  It is suggest to use event handlers instead.  Simply use the following with one of the options in the brackets: control.EventName.Handler := [“HandlingFunction”,Func(“HandlingFunction”),new Delegate(object,”Member function”).  The function that handles the event will receive an additional first parameter which contains the control that sent the event.

Assigns (or unassigns) a function to a specific event of this control so that the function will be called when the event occurs.  This is normally not necessary because functions in the GUI class with the name ControlName_EventName() will be called automatically without needing to be registered.  However this can be useful if you want to handle multiple events with a single function, e.g. for a group of radio controls.  Right now only one registered function per event is supported, let me know if you need more.

Parameters

TypeThe event name for which the function should be registered.  If a control normally calls “GUI.ControlName_TextChanged()”, specify “TextChanged” here.
FunctionNameThe name of the function specified in the window class that is supposed to handle the event.  Specify only the name of the function, skip the class.

Properties

x

x-Position of the control.

y

y-Position of the control.

width

Width of the control.

height

Height of the control.

Position

An object containing the x and y values.  They can not be set separately through this object, only both at once.

Size

An object containing the width and height values.  They can not be set separately through this object, only both at once.

Text

The text of the control.  Some controls don’t support this property.

ClassNN

The control class together with a number identify the control.

Enabled

Determines wether this control can be interacted with.

Visible

Determines wether this control is currently visible.

Style

The style of the control.

ExStyle

The extended style of the control.

Focused

True if the control currently has the focus.  It’s also possible to focus it by setting this value to true.

Tooltip

If a text is set for this value, this control will show a tooltip when the mouse hovers over it.  Text and Picture controls require that you define a g-label for them to make this work.

Menu

If this variable contains an instance of CMenu and there is no ContextMenu() event handler for this control, this menu will be shown when the user right clicks on this control or presses the AppsKey while this control has focus.

Left

The control left-aligns its text.  This is the default setting.

Center

The control center-aligns its text.

Right

The control right-aligns its text.

TabStop

If set to false, this control will not receive the focus when pressing tab to cycle through all controls.

Wrap

If enabled, the control will use word-wrapping for its text.

HScroll

Provides a horizontal scroll bar for this control if appropriate.

VScroll

Provides a vertical scroll bar for this control if appropriate.

BackgroundTrans

Uses a transparent background, which allows any control that lies behind a Text, Picture, or GroupBox control to show through.

Background

If disable, the control uses the standard background color rather than the one set by the CGUI.Color() function.

Border

Provides a thin-line border around the control.

hParentControl

If this control is a subcontrol of another control, this variable contains the window handle of the parent control.

DisableNotifications

If true, this control will not call any of its notification functions.  This is useful when the controls of a window are first created and change handlers should not be called.

Events

Introduction

There are currently 3 methods to handle control events

1) Use an event handler.  Simply use control.EventName.Handler := “HandlingFunction” Instead of “HandlingFunction” it is also possible to pass a function reference or a Delegate: control.EventName.Handler := new Delegate(Object, “HandlingFunction”) If this method is used, the first parameter will contain the control object that sent this event.

2) Create a function with this naming scheme in your window class: ControlName_EventName(params)

3) Instead of using ControlName_EventName() you may also call CControl.RegisterEvent on a control instance to register a different event function name.  This method is deprecated since event handlers are more flexible.

The parameters depend on the event and there may not be params at all in some cases.

ContextMenu

Invoked when the user right clicks on the control or presses the AppsKey while this control has focus.  If this event is not handled a static context menu can be shown by setting the Menu variable of this control to an instance of CMenu.

OnValidate

Invoked when the control is asked to validate its (textual) contents.  This event is only valid for controls containing text, which are only Edit and ComboBox controls as of now.

Parameters

TextThe current text of the control that should be validated.  The function can return this value if it is valid or another valid value.

CImageListManager

This class is used internally to manage the ImageLists of ListView/TreeView/Tab controls.  Does not need to be used directly.

CMenu represents a menu which can contain other menus and CMenu.CMenuItem
Attention!
